title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 277/93 of 8 February 1993 derogating from Regulations (EEC) No 2974/92 and (EEC) No 3212/92 concerning the basic and buying-in prices of mandarins and oranges for the 1992/93 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 277/93 of 8 February 1993 derogating from Regulations (EEC) No 2974/92 and (EEC) No 3212/92 concerning the basic and buying-in prices of mandarins and oranges for the 1992/93 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Notwithstanding Regulations (EEC) No 2974/92 and (EEC) No 3212/92 and for the period between the entry into force of this Regulation and the end of the 1992/93 marketing year, the basic and buying-in prices for mandarins and oranges fixed by Regulation (EEC) No 1378/92 shall be reduced by 17,22 % in the case of mandarins and by 11,24 % in the case of oranges to give the amounts shown in the Annex hereto.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 8 February 1993.
For the Commission
RenĂŠ STEICHEN
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 118, 20. 5. 1972, p. 1.
(2) OJ No L 180, 1. 7. 1992, p. 23.
(3) OJ No L 299, 30. 10. 1991, p. 27.
(4) OJ No L 198, 26. 7. 1988, p. 9.
(5) OJ No L 150, 15. 6. 1991, p. 8.
(6) OJ No L 299, 15. 10. 1992, p. 20.
(7) OJ No L 320, 5. 11. 1992, p. 10.
(8) OJ No L 147, 29. 5. 1992, p. 7.
(9) OJ No L 387, 31. 12. 1992, p. 10.
ANNEX
BASIC AND BUYING-IN PRICES
1992/93 marketing year
MANDARINS
For the period 12 to 28 February 1993
>TABLE>
These prices refer to quality I class mandarins, size 54 to 69 millimetres, put up in packings.
SWEET ORANGES
For the period 12 February to 31 May 1993
>TABLE>
These prices refer to oranges of the varieties Moro, Navel, Navellina, Salustiana, Sanguinello and Valencia late, quality I class, size 67 to 80 millimetres, put up in packings.
